title: Level 2: SQL Intermediate
question: Which SQL keyword is used to combine rows from two or more tables based on a related column?

title: Level 2: SQL Intermediate
question: An INNER JOIN returns only rows with matching values in both tables.

title: Level 2: SQL Intermediate
question: Which JOIN returns all rows from the left table and matched rows from the right table?

title: Level 2: SQL Intermediate
question: Complete the JOIN clause to connect `orders` and `customers` by `customer_id`:
codeTemplate: SELECT * FROM orders JOIN customers ON orders.customer_id = customers.id;

question: Which clause is used to filter records after aggregation?

title: Level 2: SQL Intermediate
question: You can use WHERE to filter grouped data in SQL.

title: Level 2: SQL Intermediate
question: What does the `IS NULL` condition check?

options.text: If a column is empty string
If a column has no value
If a column is a foreign key

title: Level 2: SQL Intermediate
question: Which clause is used to group rows that have the same values in specified columns?

title: Level 2: SQL Intermediate
question: Complete the statement to count users by country:
codeTemplate: SELECT country, COUNT(*) FROM users GROUP BY country;

title: Level 2: SQL Intermediate
question: What type of JOIN returns all records when there is a match in either left or right table?

question: A FOREIGN KEY is used to link two tables together.

title: Level 2: SQL Intermediate
question: What happens if you omit the WHERE clause in an UPDATE statement?

options.text: Only the first row is updated
All rows in the table are updated

title: Level 2: SQL Intermediate
question: Complete the syntax to define a PRIMARY KEY:
codeTemplate: CREATE TABLE users (id INT PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(100));

title: Level 2: SQL Intermediate
question: Which function returns the number of rows in a group?

title: Level 2: SQL Intermediate
question: GROUP BY is often used with aggregate functions like COUNT and AVG.

title: Level 2: SQL Intermediate
question: Complete the statement to get the average price per category:
codeTemplate: SELECT category, AVG(price) FROM products GROUP BY category;
